timeline.message: Fixed exception handling for partition lookup.  Fixed meta tool Exception wrapping.
Remove check status of transaction for partitions
Do not retrieve all records for raw queries
Retrieve results for executeJDOQLSelect within the open Query
Better handle exception being thrown by listMPartitionsWithProjection

timeline.bodyText: what if exception happens when getPartitionsInternal,  the transaction may become unbalanced
timeline.author: dengzhhu653

replies.bodyText: This is a test class.  If things become unbalanced here it doesn't really matter because the test will fail from Exception anyway.
replies.author: belugabehr

timeline.author: dengzhhu653

replies.bodyText: Sorry for the delay, my concern is that set success to true on rollbackAndCleanup here may make the transaction unable to rollback.
replies.author: dengzhhu653

replies.bodyText: OK.  I just took a look at it.  'true' here means 'do not roll back'.  This particular method is a top-level method and it is read-only.  Therefore, there will never be anything to roll back.
replies.author: belugabehr

timeline.bodyText: The transaction may unable to rollback when exception happens.
timeline.author: dengzhhu653

replies.author: dengzhhu653

replies.bodyText:
@dengzhhu653
This particular method is a top-level method and it is read-only.  Therefore, there will never be anything to roll back.
replies.author: belugabehr

replies.bodyText: When exception happens in this method, if the same ObjectStore tries to create table afterwards,  he may be unable to commit the transaction as openTrasactionCalls should be greater than 0 or rollback as the method commitTransaction returns true, the modification would be lost when metastore client shutdown.
replies.author: dengzhhu653

replies.bodyText:
@dengzhhu653 OK, I am following you now.  I will address this is new push.  Thanks so much.
This whole setup is pretty wonky (hence my inspiration to simplify the Query close stuff in this PR) and I'd like to address, but in another JIRA.
replies.author: belugabehr

replies.bodyText: I found that using try (QueryWrapper wrapper = new QueryWrapper()) does not need to add a catch clause comparing to try(Query q = pm.newQuery(....)).
replies.author: dengzhhu653

timeline.message: Track success and rollback if required
